summary: Walruses are big marine mammals living near the North Pole. They have tusks and whiskers and can weigh over 2,000 kg. There are two types: Atlantic and Pacific walruses. They live in shallow water and eat molluscs. Walruses are important in Arctic culture and were hunted for their blubber and ivory. This hunting lowered their population, but it has started to increase again.
title: Walrus
